of mars. tars also come in two age ranges: those near layered terrain are generally several million years old and inactive, while the ones near llds are young and may still be actively forming and moving. my theory is that the very young tars are found near the large dark dunes, which are also very young, because the sand blowing off the dunes provides the energy needed to form tars, Matthew Balme said. a weaker loonie is apt to result in softer sales, Robert M Hanson doesn't expect canadian business to completely whither. he recalls that canadians still were frequenting gander mountain when their dollar was worth less than 70 cents u.s. they came because of our selection, and we still offered a better value to them than they could find at home, Robert M Hanson said. although the canadian dollar doesn't stretch as far as it used to in the states, he pointed out that lower gas prices should lessen the cost of driving, potentially making minnesota a more attractive

to raise rates again. but the global environment is not at all like it was late in 2001, when the bank halted an even more daunting fall in the exchange rate with an emergency interest rate hike. the issue facing the reserve bank now is how much is this going to affect inflation, said standard chartered regional africa head Razia Khan .
